transportAdvice: Portland has a well-developed public transit system including light rail, streetcar, and bus lines that connect most major neighborhoods and tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The city is also highly walkable and bike-friendly in its central districts, and taxis as well as rideshare vehicles are readily available throughout the metro area.

weather.description: Cold and frequently rainy with overcast skies; pack waterproof layers and expect limited sunshine.
Still wet and grey but slightly milder than January, with occasional breaks of sun.
Rain continues but days grow longer and temperatures begin to climb noticeably.
Spring arrives with blooming flowers and a mix of showers and pleasant sunny spells.
Mild and increasingly pleasant with more dry days and lush green surroundings.
Early summer brings warm, mostly dry days that are ideal for outdoor exploration.
The warmest and driest month of the year with long sunny days and very little rain.
Continues hot and dry, perfect for hiking and outdoor activities; occasional wildfire smoke possible.
Warm and largely dry with comfortable temperatures and the first hints of autumn color.
Autumn brings cooler temperatures and returning rain, with beautiful fall foliage across the city.
Noticeably wet and grey as winter sets in; a good rain jacket becomes essential.
Cold, damp, and often overcast with occasional frost; the holiday season adds festive atmosphere to the city.
